p:
In order to estimate the number of BCoV RNA genome copies (GC), a standard curve was prepared using tenfold dilutions of a plasmid containing the BCoV target sequence. The BCoV RNA positive control was aliquoted and included in every RT-qPCR plate as a calibrator to adjust for inter-plate variation. The number of GC in clinical samples was calculated using the formula from Livak and Schmittgen [ 19]:
\documentclass[12pt]{minimal} \usepackage{amsmath} \usepackage{wasysym} \usepackage{amsfonts} \usepackage{amssymb} \usepackage{amsbsy} \usepackage{mathrsfs} \usepackage{upgreek} \setlength{\oddsidemargin}{-69pt} \begin{document}$$ {Q}_s={Q_c}^{\ast }{\left(1+E\right)}^{-\left({Ct}_s-{Ct}_c\right)} $$\end{document}
Q s
=
Q c
∗
1 + E
−
Ct s
−
Ct c
Where Q
s
= sample RNA copy number, Q
c
= calibrator RNA copy number, Ct
s
= sample Ct value, Ct
c
= calibrator Ct value and E = efficiency of target amplification.
